S.FORM: kasauny pitju milingan a ku sina gakuan.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: patagilj anga kitulu, ljetaladj anga sinsi sema kiusic, qivu a hanciw:“ gacalju! kicungalu !”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: gerengi a lukay:“ djavadjavy sinsi.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: a sini tulu na nia sinsi pakata pinaiwanan a semupu
S.TRANSL: 上課老師教我們，關於數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Paiwan language of numbers.

S.FORM: timitja kiciuli ta sinsi kisupu, na semenay a men ta semupu a senay.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: liaw anga u kinasaigu a pinaiwanan.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Paiwan languages.

S.FORM: ljemita ta qadaw ma gakku a ken, ljemita ta qadaw kitulutulu tua pinaiwanan, uli kiljavaljang sasi palanda tja kina.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Paiwan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: a ku ngadan ti muakay.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是muakay。
My name is muakay.

S.FORM: a ngadan na ku kama ti camak.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是camak。
My dad’s name is camak.

S.FORM: a ngadan na ku kina ti savan.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是savan。
My mother’s name is savan.

S.FORM: tucu puluq anga ku cavilj.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: izua ku kaka tjavulung a uqaljay, a ngadan nimadju ti buka, tucu puluq sa ita anga cavilj nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫buka，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is buka, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: kitulutulu amen itau mamaw a gaku.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: tjengelay semenay ken kata tjavulung a kaka uqaljay.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: tjengelay ken a kemavekav, nu pulavay, tiamen taqumaqanan maciuciul vaik a kemavekav.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: tjengelay ken sekeljang tua atalasi a qali, dikilu amen maciul a semenay kata kemavekav.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: tiaken na paiwan a aljak.
S.TRANSL: 我是排灣族的小孩。
I am an Paiwan child.

S.FORM: a nia kinaizuanan imaza i taitu king taren guan a tjuabar mula.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在台東縣達仁鄉土坂村。
Our family lives in tjuabar.

S.FORM: malje lima men a taqumaqanan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tiamen taqumaqanan izua ma tjelu a siruvetjek.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: na matevelj amen kata ku kama, kina, tjavulung a kaka uqaljay kata vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: qaca ku kama, kisace a ku kama.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: kuljay a ku kina. kuisan a ku kina.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: nu i tjumaq amen ti kama lukayan na men ta pinaiwanan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the paiwan language with us at home.

S.FORM: nu kilavay tua kalja zalangezangan ru vaik amen a sema qinaljan.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: tiaken kata tjavulung a kaka uaqaljay vavayan ru kaciul a djemekep tua ceqel.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: tjengelay a ken tua u taqumaqanan.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡我的家人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: nu saunay uli vaik amen kivanvan kati kina.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: nu maqadaw cangiangia a kalevelevan, ika ljaljeqel ika semezam tauta, sudjusy a vali.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: na qemiladj amen itua zaleman kemakan ta pang, aza teljare na qadaw pazarezar itua kacavacavan, semeljec aravac.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光照在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: makakincengelj, masan qudjidjilj a kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: ku kivadaqan ti kina, akumaya qudjidjilj a kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: aya ti kina, masa uli mangetjez anga buhu.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: nuqezemetj neka qerepus i kalevelevan, tjevutanga vitjuqan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: uli vaik anga men matjumaq tauta.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: a si vaikan matjumaq a djalan, kipenetj aken tua vitjuqan.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願.
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: ulja ika mangetjez a buhu, sa vaik anan na ken ljisasaw a kivanvan.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: a ku gaku i gidi tua nia umaq, ljemita ta qadaw djemavadjavac aken a magaku, djemavac matjumaq tauta.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ika qaca nia gaku, mapulju a situ, makakeljang a mapuljat.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: mapuljat a qaqunuan rumaqepu i unduzin, maciul a kivanvan ta bulu, maciul a pakatateveravera.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: a mareka sinsi kiciul tjanuamen a kivanvan, tauta, a gaku matu na mirazek a cemekemekelj.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: nu ljemita qadaw semuap amen, aza kiusic tja paka suapen a palimasudj.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: izua djemuas ta qezung, izua vaik a semuap ta kalavan.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: nuaya tiamen nia suapen a i gaku mareka putuputung, maqaqepu mareka pusaladj, nu ljemita qadaw aza i gaku na siki.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: katiaw, na vaik aken i qinaljan a paljilji ta ku vuvu uqaljay.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: sicuayan anga tja sincevuan, singelit aken tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: ti vuvu uqaljay ka pacun tjanuaken, pakanan na ken tua suyka, patekelang na ken ta ucia.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: a talem ni vuvu uqaljay a suyka qaljemeqem, sanguaq aravac.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken temekel ta ni vuvu uqaljay a ucia tauta, nutja tekelen sanguaq uta.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: ka hilu, na maciul aken kati vuvu vavayan keman ta kincengelj.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: ti vuvu vavayan a kinsa cengelj liaw djamay, izua ciqaw, izua vuyu, izua siak, izuanan dingding.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: nu pakakan ta cengelj, uli vaik amen mapuljacengan kiaya tua ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: na malap ti vuvu vavayan tu liaw ta vurasi, vasa, kata lakiu pavay tjanuaken, sipakacu a matjumaq.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: vaik aken kipusau tjamadju, patjumalj nu tjaivililj uli vaik anan a paljilji tjamadju.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: kasauny kacuing amen na nia sinsi maqaqaquzipan, i paljing amen kilasudj a venely ta kipu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: ka ljitaladj ta qaqaquzipan, aya ti sinsi:“ aza i sangas pakata qayaqayam, aza i likuz pakata kanaqatjuvian, kitimun a patjatjauvaik a pacun ta talidu.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: malekutj a ken tua qatjuvi, sika ini pacun na ken ta kanaqatjuvian.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: na pacung a ken ta liaw a qayaqayam, tiamadju i tua kasiw pavavaw a minlayalayap, izuanan pinacunan a ljequ na taqed itua na kasiw a belung.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: aza qaqaquzipan izua zung, unma kata tjakakudralan a ngiangiyaw, kasicuayan inianan pacung ta namitucu a dubuc, kasauny ku pacunan maleva racac.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: liaw a u sinasin, uli sipapacung ta u kama kati kina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，要給我爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: nu tjaivililj uli kiciul a ken tja kama kina maciul a semamaza.
S.TRANSL: 下次我要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: tucu kilavay, uli vaik amen kata tjavulung a kaka vavayan ma taitu paljilji ta djisan.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: uli ljivavaw men ta kisiya kemasi taihuk ma taitu.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: djemaljung i taitu, ti djisan emungeting ta haiya mangetjez i tisiaba kicevung tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: aza disiaba demut ta umaq ni djisan, ika cuay a ungeting djemaljung.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: i dudut ta umaq ni djisan izua qacaqaca a papagungan, maciuciul amen padjidingsia mata papagungan.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: ka i papagungan, ti djisan kacuing amen pakan ta sizi kata kiqadraqadr tua unma.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: ka masulem, maciul amen ma hici a keman.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: aza hici liaw a zidusia, avanasika pautubay men a mazua.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: ka uli vaikanga men, sedjumak tu na macakaw a nia utubay, sa vaikanga men ljivavaw ta basu.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: tucu uli vaikanga men sema taihuk, qadjaw kidjinumak anga a utubay ni djisan.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: ka qaqunuan a nia umaq i tjuabar, ka magaku anga, patjavat a sema taihuk. imazamaza i hici a sikac.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家在土坂，上學以後，就搬到了台北，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in tjuabar. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: ka temakesi anga ta daigaku, na peniliq a ken tua ita pakata na kacalisian bunka a kituluan, pualang anga za kacalisian tu izua maretimaljimalji na talidu a bunka i taiwan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: manasika, tucu a cavilj nu pakilavay tua kaljazalangezangan, uli vaik amen kata u kaka uqaljay sema qinaljan, kivadaq ta ramaljemaljeng, saljinga tu kemeljang tua nimitja zuku a bunka.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: aza ramaljeng alu puluq anga cavilj, ljakua nu tja pacunan matu tjaukaramaljeng.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: u kivadaqan timadju macaqu tua pida kai. tauliq ravac nu lukai timadju ta pinaiwanan, saigu a lukai ta na muqami a kai tauta.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的排灣語說得很流利，也會說日本話和阿美語。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Paiwan, as well as Japanese and Pangcah.

S.FORM: manu ka qaqunuan timadju na kitulu ta pinaiwanan, a cekelj amizuku, sa za sengsengan nimadju makakeljan kata tjuluvu a ripung caucau, avansika liaw kinasiagu a kai.
S.TRANSL: 原來他小時候就學排灣語，太太是阿美族人，而他工作上認識許多日本人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Paiwan languages when he was a child, his wife is an Pangcah, and he knows many Japenese at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: ka kitjaucikel amen, aza ramaljeng na tjemaucikel tu liaw pakata qemaljup a kakudan.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: kumalji ika men maqati a sepualang kiselangda, ljakua na emaya men ta itua lima dingwa a remuing, maqati mumalj kigalju a kilangeda.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: ka qaqunuan ika pualang tua pasa niaken zuku a bunka, pakata kacalisian angata ken izua keri a siaqan.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: ka tjaivililj liaw anga pinualang, u kinemenemen tiaken paiwanzuku a caucau, na pakisumalji angata, pacengceng si ilasian uta.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，我覺得自己身為排灣族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a paiwan is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: nusauny masulem, uli sema tjumaq anga tjakeri a kaka uqaljay.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: tiaken vuvu a vavayan vaik maiciba veneli ta vuyu, padjulu a kemesa ta sanguanguaq a kaiven sipakan ta u kaka tjakeri a uqaljay.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: na cemalivat amen tua paveliveli ta ljaceng, aza sipaveliveli liaw na nasasanguaq a ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: na venely amen ta ingcay, qaqilj kata daikung.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: aza i gidi a paveliveli ta kudamunu a tawki qivu:“ a ku pangudralj kata qudis qaljemeqem. veliu tu keri pay!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: na veneli amen ta pangudralj kata qudis.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: ka cemalivat amen ta paveliveli tua vutjulj, aza tawki qivu anema su velin? kasauny a vuyu kudral tu qalev, nu ita tjelu taidai a paisu.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: paka pazangal ti vuvu vavayan, kivadaqan a tawki tuki maqati a pumadjuluing.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: ljakua aya tawki madjulu anga, dikinay anga kiluvadan.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: aza i tjuljivar a tawki qivu, idu veliu ta ku ciqaw, a ku ciqaw kudral tu madjulu.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: kavililjanga venely a men ta vuyu kata ciqaw tauta, sema tjumaq kemesa ta tacukui a djamay.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: kemaljava cuayanga, masulem anga a kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: ti kaka tjakeri a uqaljay padingwa mangetjez a qivu, papintjus tu ika semekez anga i sividay, nu tjaivililj a niciubi mana dikilu a mangetjez.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: aya ti vuvu vavayan liaw a kinesanga, qaqivu a mapuljat kaciruri a keman!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: na djemaulj a men ta marekasusu kata qalialian, maciul paselingulj a keman.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: izua u dukiusi ti kapi, timadju ru draudraw kemacu ta nemanga.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Kapi，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Kapi, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: ka kitulutul amen, na kisedjam timadju ta na dukiusi a inpic, siquliqulip kata qadupu.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: puita, pudrusa, putjelu, aza salasaladj pukaui a pasedjam ta nemanga tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: izua damidami a kakudan nimadju, ru kisedjam ta nemanga sa ika pacikel anga.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: kavililjanga a mapuljat ika sa pasedjam ta nemanga tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: izua tu ita qadaw, na maciul amen vaik a kivanvan.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: ka i kadjalanan, sa mabinziu ti kapi, ljakua madraudraw kemacu timadju ta sidjuadjuas.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，kapi想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Kapi wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: na kisedjam timadju ta salasaladj ta sidjuadjuas, ljakua maitucu temevela a mapuljat tjaimadju, ika nakemacu a ken tauta.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: ti kapi qemauqaung ta latjakan, matjalaw timadju qivu, akumaya ika nu pasedjaman na ken ta sidjuadjuas!!
S.TRANSL: kapi急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!
Kapi burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: tjumaljang na salasaladj timadju, lja ika sun na rukacut, saka nu pasedjaman sun ta nemanga, ika sun na pacikel.
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: kamaljia magaku, medjama sema gaku ti kapi, aza kinisedjam ta salasaladj a nemanga pinacikel anga penuljat ta dukiusi.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，kapi很早就到學校了，Kapi把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Kapi arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: ti kapi kipaqaljay ta dukiusi, sa qivu nu tjaivililj tjara kemacu ta niaken a nemanga, masalu tjanumun ka tjaisangas pukaui a pasedjam ta nemanga tja nuaken.
S.TRANSL: kapi向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Kapi apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: a ku kama na i qinaljan a cinunan.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: ka qaqunuan na ken, ti kama kati djisan nu itua qezemezemetj vaik a ljesasaw, kemacu ta tjakit kata kuwang.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: numaljia, mangetjez tiamadju a na kemacu ta djinameq a sacemel.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: nucuayanga vavuy, nucuayanga lava, nuaya izua padjavatan uta.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: aza sacemel qaluqaluten niamadju i siljitaladj tua qinaljan a paljing, pasleva tua sikataqaljan.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: sakamaya ru qemevaw a ken tja kama, sa kiciul a qemaljup kati kama.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: aya ti kama nu meqaca sun, ku su kacuaw anga.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了，他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: a i qinaljan a uqaljaqaljay macaqu a pudringay djemekep ta sacemel, tiamadju saigu cukulu ta veceqel a dringay kata siqezetjan tua qaciljay a dringay.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: a ku kama saigu a cukulu ta veceqel a dringay, aya ti kama, aicu uli sidringay ta padjavatan, tja kigaljuing a ljemengljeng za na sacemel a djekap, za dringay tja pizuaing ta na sacemel vinaikan a djaljan.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: ulja dikilu a kilimu kata ramaljeng maciul a qemaljup, nu ljemita qadaw kicaquan a cukulu ta dringay, aza u dringay uli palamu anga paqulid a maqati djemameq tua sacemel.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: ti ka pacunan na ken qivu tjanuaken, nu tjaivililj tjara masan saiguan sun a cinunan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說,我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: tucu meqacanga ken, ku sevaljeng a u panaq kata vakela, kiciul ta ku kama vaik a qemaljup.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: ka sema qinaljan, aza nia djinameq a sacemel uli pasleva tua sikataqaljan.
S.TRANSL: 回村時，將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: aya ti kama, masalu aravac tana qemati a sinipagaugaw. pavayan itjen tu liaw ta sacemel a manguaqan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: ta kadjaman gemalju aken a ma tatakisian.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: tazua vayke sema tatakesiyan, ini paqenedjanga aken a masi qabang.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: ini ken na kemacu ta nanemangau.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: a kitulutulu tazua, maciyul a pacun ta kadup aken kata dukiwsi.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: a semekiseking tazua, pasedjaman aken ta inpic kata sisumasumang na dukiwsi.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: kakivuin aken na sinsi, “nu djavililj gacaljuanga kilimu, maya gemalj anga!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”

S.FORM: ti kadrw a ku ’aliyan angta.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫kadrw，他也是排灣族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is kadrw, and he is also an Paiwan child.

S.FORM: na maciyul a men a kisupu i kaaluwan.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在kaaluwan讀書。
We study together in the kaaluwan tribe.

S.FORM: djaluljes amen a maciyul kilangda ta djawcikel a milimilimgan na lamaljeng, macaqu amen qivu ta pinaywanan.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說排灣語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Paiwan proficiently.

S.FORM: ljavavaw aken sa mekaca, ti kadrw maliljay sa kedrikedri.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，kadrw很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while kadrw is short and thin.

S.FORM: lu talivakan ti kadraw, djengelay a men djay madju a mapuljat.
S.TRANSL: kadrw很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
kadrw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: ungdukay na i gaku tu sa qadaw, maljeliyav a kamuku sinipa malalumaljan na gaku.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school’s sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: izua malalakac ta calis, sema kula a benulu, mekelj, dremaiyan, katua penana.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: ta mekelj a ku malalumaljan.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: tazua a mekelj aken, sekulilj aken, pedjamu tu liyav a cungal.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: ljakua migacalj aken, sa pazulunge a mekelj a pasasangas.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: maleva cawcaw anga a djemaljun aken.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: nuavan na ini a malap ta sangasangasa. ljaqua maleva ken alavac. ayatua na paudeze anga ken tua kinimalalumaljan.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn’t get first place, I’m glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: na paljilji ta ku ama aken ati kama ta tiyiv.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: na mapasa’edju a kula ni ama.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: djmaljan amen ni madjuna, makapalaq tu ita beleng a na umaq a ’aljiv.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: a ljemengungu ta ’aljiv na umaq ti madju, makelu anga kemasi ta umaq na ’aljiv.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: na kemacu ti kama ta na gung a vudjulj ‘ata saviki sipavay djay ama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: i ’umaan a mazazepezep a ken ati ama.liyav a milimilinga sini djawcikel ni madju.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: a muri vayika anga ken, zemengel ti ama tu mekacanga ken, mapavalit tu djasawqaljay tu.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: ’evu ken, “nu menguwa anga su kula ama, keljuanga ta nia umaq kivangavang nu djayvililj tu.”
S.TRANSL: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”

S.FORM: i ta drusa kuzulj sa drusa pulu sa drusa cavilj, na kaygi anga a asihu a pita mibungsiw na kacalisiyan ta ngadan makayanga pasa ita ngadan nua kinacalisianan.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: na humung aken ta cuacuayanga kilevuci pasa ta sihu a pita mibusuw pizuwanan ta “pasa ita ngadan na kinacalisian’’ i qinalja a maacuvucuvung. lja savan ti camaq.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年camaq。
I interviewed camaq, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: tucu a sisekesekez a qadaw na pinedjan aken ati madju tu mazuwa ta umaq nimadj a humung.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: a humung tazuw, pasemalaven aken ni madju tu pinakasinuan a ngadan ni madju, utanga kacuin aken a pakeljang ta tacekeljan ni madju, ta qinaljan ni madju.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: ku kivadaan ti madju a kumaya ki temezeng pasupavalit ta ngadan, nakuya sipavecikana a kakudanan ta sicuayan.
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: kakivuin aken ni madju, ayatua na sipavecikan ta ciniwkukan ini a mapacengceng a pkeljangn ta ngadan ni madju, azuma cawcaw maytucu anan a qivu “ca sinsi” ut manasika sidjawljan tu paseliyaw tua penapedjeli.
S.TRANSL: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「查先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him “Cha Xian Sheng”, which resulted in many jokes being made.

S.FORM: lja savan ti camaq kivu, “a tja kaulidan a ngadan nu kinakacalisiyan a sivecikan ta ngadan mavan na djaljemedjem, aza ku ngadan sikaqeljangan tu anema men nu zukan, ljanema men a djumaan, nidjen a kinapatalevanan i kacawan. puzangalan tu makaya maljeliav azukan a cawcaw kipakim ta su kiningadangan.”
S.TRANSL: our family
camaq kivu said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: ta tiyav ti aken kati vuvu avavayan vayke a ma icipa ta papaveliyanan, na kemacu ti vuvu avavayan ta liyav a namakakayzuazua a sinitalem a lacing, utanga sikipualan ta na kacalisiyan a kakanen sipakan tua mapuljat.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: na djengelay a mapuljat ta ni vuvu a papaveliyanan, a kamangulj ata luni maljeleav a cawcaw veneli, maljeleav a cawcaw mangedjez a keman ta sinanljaceng ni madju.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: sanguwa alavac a kines ni madju a lukuce kata djuadjuay a kinsa. izuanan a siljatu ta vavuy pinasazuan ta daykung kata tjana, aza saluman masiljudje ta maljeliyav a kaljakalja. mangdjez a mapuljat sa madjuljul ita niamen a papaveliyan.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: nu kemesakesa ta nemanga ti vuvu, i djuljival aken a djemawdjaulj ta kaljakalja. i djuljival a ken a mezangal a djemawdjaw, “a ljaceng savtde a niya sinitalem, ini a pinizuanan ta kahiliyuan a si vevuan, veliyu a kilalimu lja!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: a nia nemanga ma veli a kilimu, kivuta vuvu, “masa izuwa sun a paqeljing.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, “It’s all thanks to your help.”

S.FORM: aicua a kinipusengsenganan, izua ku kinituluan paka ta kacalisiyan a zazumuk katuwa sikeljangan ta kakanen a kakudan, mayanga izua nga kinakeljangan ta kipusngesngan ita papavelian aza luljayan.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: pacunan ti vuvu djengelay alavaca tua semicuacuayan a kakanen, djevalungan aken ta samamaljian a acianan atuwa puzangalan.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
